question: 乏しい
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>scarce</kanji>? It's also <vocabulary>scarce</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: When things are <vocabulary>scarce</vocabulary>, you have <reading>to bo</reading>at (<ja>とぼ</ja>) all the way across the lake to find any resources or food, as your side of the lake is picked dry.
